title: zuzie
author: zuzie
created_time: January 04, 2023, 05:03:09 AMLast edit: June 21, 2023, 11:41:09 AM by zuzie
content: Welcome to Saudi Professional League threadI think we need to create a new discussion thread regarding the Saudi Professional League as we know one of the famous players in the world is now playing in this leagueit's possible that other famous players could join in so it's worth discussing, please discuss anything related to the Saudi League latest Match, News or new Players.

comments.author: Tipeform$
comments.body: Welcome to open this new topic of Saudi Arabia.  Earlier there was no topic of discussion about Saudi Arabia.  Al Nassr club won two of the new games in two clubs in Saudi Arabia.  Currently world famous star CR7 has joined Al Nassr club.  This is Al Nassr club's biggest chance to get a better star and reputation as a course in the future.photosource

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: The SPL has been in the news lately after one of the richest clubs, Al Nassr, signed Ronaldo.after 3 seasons Al Nassr failed to get the SPL trophy. this season they will appear more promising. moreover their strong competitor Al Hilal is also experiencing performance degradation problems.The SPL doesn't get much attention in the media, but after Ronaldo's presence, I'm sure European media will also focus on the Saudi league. So far the top 5 standings are still competitive with a not-so-big difference in points.

comments.author: LDL
comments.created_time: January 04, 2023, 06:17:01 AMLast edit: January 04, 2023, 06:29:02 AM by LDL
comments.body: Gambling discussion thread has laliga football discussion thread, Spanish football discussion thread, Italian football discussion thread, English premier League discussion thread, French football discussion thread and so many more but today we get a new football discussion thread SPL(Soudi Professional League) discussion thread. Thank you @OP for opening such an important thread, we can always discuss important updates of Saudi Arabia Professional Football League here.  Below are the important teams included in SPL.

comments.author: Mustang Shelby
comments.body: Here is the title I was looking for.  As a Cristiano Ronaldo fan, it's great to have a topic we can discuss.  Al-Nassr is already the strongest team in the Saudi league.  In fact, if I need to speak a little more assertively, with a few good transfers, he is at the level to easily play with big teams in Europe and beat them.  They have quality names such as Talisca, Aboubakar, Ospina in their squad.  And then Cristiano came, they'll probably make a few more good transfers in the interim transfer.  I will be following this league with interest from now on.

comments.author: makishart
comments.body: It seems like that people were paying more attention to the SPL after ronaldo has been joining with al nassr. I guess this league will become even more popular since al nassr will try t bring more professional players to the its club. I hope that al hilal will try to sign messi. This gonna create a very big hype to the SPL. We know that if al hilal was a rival for al nassr pretty much the same like barcelona against madrid in la liga. More stars will help SPL to be even more popular. Ronaldo's fan will not even miss any match from al nassr.

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: @OP you should edit your first post and add pictures with names of Saudi professional league teams.  Many people do not know anything about SPL in detail.  If the names of the teams are mentioned in your post, it will play a much more important role to discuss the details.  You can make this SPL football discussion thread very interesting by editing a lot of things in your first post.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: After the last WC in Qatar, the SPL has the opportunity to recruit more proven players and not only give preference to football stars, of course Ronaldo signed a contract with Al-Nassr for 2.5 years for $ 200 million a year, but his time passes, however, he is able to warm up interest in the SPL, and attract quite young and promising players.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Ronaldo made them to catch the eye of world media,I mean Al Nassr is everywhere in sport pages and newspapers,online and offline which are talking about Ronaldo and his total deal together with publicity and every thing else that will net him 500 million dollars for 2 years of signing with the club there.He has even a clause in his contract that permits him to be in loan to Newcastle since Newcastle is owned by Saudi State Fund if Newcastle qualifies for the Champions League during next year.

comments.author: Sithara007
comments.body: Quote from: LDL on January 04, 2023, 06:35:39 AM@OP you should edit your first post and add pictures with names of Saudi professional league teams.  Many people do not know anything about SPL in detail.  If the names of the teams are mentioned in your post, it will play a much more important role to discuss the details.  You can make this SPL football discussion thread very interesting by editing a lot of things in your first post.User LDL added the logos of all the teams in first division (Saudi Pro League). There is no doubt that the presence of Cristiano Ronaldo will get a lot of hype and viewership for this league. He has fans all around the globe and that means that the matches of Al-Nassr will be watched by millions of people outside the Arabian peninsula. BTW, Ronaldo is not the only star player who will be part of the SPL. Top scorer (so far) of this season is Brazilian international Talisca, who also plays for the Al Nassr Football Club. There are also other foreign players at Al Nassr, including Vincent Aboubakar, Pity Martínez, Luiz Gustavo, Álvaro González and Jaloliddin Masharipov.

comments.author: Popkon6
comments.body: (OP) welcome at the outset because Saudi Arabia had no room for negotiation.  Tomorrow 5th January Al-Nassr vs Al Tai will be played by two clubs.  We will certainly enjoy the games of these two clubs and the joy of the audience will rise in the hearts of the audience.  Here at Al Nassr club, there are stars from different countries who are known as one of the best footballers in the world of football and have gained a lot of fame in this World Cup.  Football lovers are invited to enjoy this game.

comments.author: Rigon
comments.body: OP, thank you for opening the Saudi professional thread. We can discuss in all club threads but we can't discuss because this Saudi professional has no thread. Currently a much talked about and world class player CR7 has joined Al Nasser club in Saudi Arabia. From now on I can discuss all the updated news in this Saudi professional trade. Again my best regards to the OP.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Wow, I'm very happy to see the topic of the Saudi Professional League (SPL) on this board, as we know that after Cristiano Ronaldo's move to Al-Nassr, this league is getting more attention from the public. Hopefully with this topic, we can get to know the Saudi Professional League deeper and better.Here I also want to provide a list of players who used to be top in Europe and are now playing in this league, here is the list:1. Al-NassrDavid Ospina (GK) - Anderson Talisca (MF) - Cristiano Ronaldo (FW) - Vincent Aboubakar (FW)2. Al-ShababGrzegorz Krychowiak (MF) - Ever Banega (MF) - Santi Mina (CF)3. Al-IttihadHelder Costa (MF)4. Al-HilalOdion Ighalo (CF) - Luciano Vietto (CF)5. AbhaFelipe Caicedo (CF)

comments.author: rendravolt
comments.body: Maybe most people will glance at the Saudi Professional League because of CR7's arrival to Al-Nassr and of course everyone also wants to watch his work in a place where he is no longer young. So it's very interesting that the fact that CR7 can attract many football fans to this league. There are even rumors that there will be a top European player who will also be chased by several clubs from the SPL, making club competition in this league look even more exciting to watch.Anyway, Thanks OP for creating this thread.

comments.author: Tipeform$
comments.body: The world famous football star Cristiano Ronaldo (CR7) joined the Al Nassr club in Saudi Arabia, and the name has emerged in the football world of Saudi Arabia.  Ever since Ronaldo Nassr joined the club, this club has been heavily criticized and not only Ronaldo but also world famous stars from different countries.  Like, AbouBakar, Talisca, Pity Martinez and many more players.  But the Al Nassr club will bring a lot of fame from Saudi Arabia.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Al-Nassr next match will happen tomorrow against Al-Taee, does we will see the first match Ronaldo in this team? The previous match Ronaldo didn't play, sad enough. There's an article where I read Majed Abdullah was an all time high scorers in Al-Nassr, so Ronaldo need to make at least 190 goals in order to break that record. I think if the coach always let Ronaldo to play, in 3 years I believe Ronaldo will break that record.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: OP, you read my mind,yesterday night I was telling a friend that I need to create a thread on SPL but couldn't do that before I slept off. I was so happy to see this thread this morning here and I must say I appreciate your love for Ronaldo because it is Ronaldo that is making us look to into SPL.Ronaldo is a super star and will always add value to any club that he is playing,his fans will always go wherever he goes with him because of his professional football pattern, no matter is awkward characters

comments.author: Dewi Aries
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on January 04, 2023, 10:00:02 AMAl-Nassr next match will happen tomorrow against Al-Taee, does we will see the first match Ronaldo in this team? The previous match Ronaldo didn't play, sad enough. There's an article where I read Majed Abdullah was an all time high scorers in Al-Nassr, so Ronaldo need to make at least 190 goals in order to break that record. I think if the coach always let Ronaldo to play, in 3 years I believe Ronaldo will break that record.I'm not familiar with the players in this league except for Ronaldo of course so for a while we can only predict based on the ranking of each teamMost of each team has played 11 matches and the current top scorer is Talisca with 9 goals it's not difficult for Ronaldo to take overI think Ronaldo can do it in 5-6 matches or before reaching mid-season.

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: Quote from: Dewi Aries on January 04, 2023, 10:51:12 AMI'm not familiar with the players in this league except for Ronaldo of course so for a while we can only predict based on the ranking of each teamMost of each team has played 11 matches and the current top scorer is Talisca with 9 goals it's not difficult for Ronaldo to take overI think Ronaldo can do it in 5-6 matches or before reaching mid-season.it depends on how Ronaldo adapts to the Saudi league. of course, this will be quite different from the European league where he has been playing. I hope he's not in serious trouble.but if you look at the standings, it looks like the Saudi league is quite competitive. even though several seasons have been won by the same club. but it looks like this season looks more interesting.

comments.author: YinShuiSiYuan
comments.body: Very good move to create this thread,  this is not just about Ronaldo world will know about Saudi league and their teams and players . Before this thread there are only European league threads , now this  will promote and develop people know how about Arab league . How can only one player change the popularity of any country we are experiencing that now .Looking forward to Ronaldos first match tomorrow .
